summary: This document is a chain of emails from June-July 2019 among FBI and DOJ personnel coordinating a conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails show logistical planning for a call involving the FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force and Victim Services Division, specifically concerning Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers (CAFIs).

events.title: Planned conference call on Epstein victim interviews
events.description: A conference call was scheduled for 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case, involving FBI NY Criminal Division Violent Crimes Task Force and Victim Services Division personnel.

events.title: Hospitalization of participant
events.description: One participant in the planned call indicates they are in the hospital and would only be able to call in.

events.title: SDNY meeting and ADIC case brief
events.description: Reference to a 2:30 meeting at the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and an Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) requesting a case brief at 3:30 PM.

keyFacts: The FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force and Victim Services Division were actively coordinating in June/July 2019 to conduct victim interviews in the Epstein case.
Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers (CAFIs) from the FBI's Child Victim Services Unit were involved in the planning.
The email chain reveals logistical challenges, including a participant being hospitalized and scheduling around other meetings at SDNY.
The correspondence shows inter-agency coordination within the FBI (Criminal Division and Victim Services Division) on the Epstein investigation.
